clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiac Toxicity in Medical Treatment of Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Cardiac Toxicity in Medical Treatment of Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
This study will describe the epidemiology including prognosis of heart failure related to treatment with anthracycline and trastuzumab for breast cancer.
In a prospective study Human Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor 2 (HER2) positive breast cancer patients scheduled for trastuzumab treatment at Odense University Hospital, will be offered advanced echocardiographic examination, test of bio-markers and genetic markers for the purpose of investigating if early identification of patients in particular risk of developing heart failure is feasible.

primary_outcome.measure: Global longitudinal strain by two dimentional speckle tracking.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in outcome from initiation of trastuzumab treatment and after 3,6, and 9 month.

primary_outcome.measure: Ratio between the mitral E velocity and early diastolic maximum global strain rate (E/SRE).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in outcome from initiation of trastuzumab treatment and after 3,6, and 9 month.

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples will be analyzed for N-terminal proBNP and ultra-sensitive TnT. Targeted sequencing of a limited number of well-known genes related to heart failure will be conducted and analysis of potential future biomarkers related to heart failure is possible from blood samples stored in a biobank.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with HER2 positive breast cancer in adjuvant treatment with trastuzumab.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of HER2 positive breast cancer
- Adjuvant treatment with trastuzumab
Exclusion Criteria:
- Left ventricle ejection fraction (LVEF) <50%
- Chronic or persistent atrial fibrillation
- History of moderate or severe valvular heart disease.

clinical_study.keyword: Heart failure related to medical treatment of breast cancer
